comments:
Hi,

I have a SQL statement that returns three columns for a line chart:  time (X-axis), rate (Y-axis) and entity (each value is a line over time).  When the SQL statement returns a result set with a least one row, I will see a line chart under "View Report in Web Viewer" (or the other options).  However, if the result set is empty, the following exception gets thrown:

org.eclipse.birt.chart.exception.ChartException: Unable to use a non-datetime data to render a datetime axis.  
at org.eclipse.birt.chart.factory.Generator.build(Generator.java:983)
at org.eclipse.birt.chart.reportitem.ChartReportItemPresentationImpl.onRowSets(ChartReportItemPresentationImpl.java:453)
at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.presentation.LocalizedContentVisitor.processExtendedContent(LocalizedContentVisitor.java:651)
at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.presentation.LocalizedContentVisior.visitForeign(LocalizedContentVisitor.java:359)
...


However, when I preview the query in the Dataset dialog box in "Preview Results", no exception is thrown (whether there are any rows or not).

Thanks.

Fred
Reassign to chart team for further research.

I think this bug has been resolved with #160517(null empty dataset won't been used to render chart). You could try 2.2M6 or 2.1.3 build or nightly build after 20070225.
Thanks.

traces.message: Unable to use a non-datetime data to render a datetime axis.
